title: functions used in KWB project MIA-CSO
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install kwb.miacso in R install.packages('kwb.miacso')  # Browse the kwb.miacso manual pages help(package = 'kwb.miacso')

MS Access Databases (Hydraulic Data) — hmdb
text: ... arguments passed miamdb

what: Get Metadata About Data Sources — hsDataSource
title: Get Metadata About Data Sources — hsDataSource
text: Returns list containing full path Access database, table name, name timestamp field, name parameter field table contains data parameter parName, measured monitoring point moniPoint data quality level qua.level.

title: Get Metadata About Data Sources — hsDataSource
code: hsDataSource(   qua.level = NULL,   moniPoint = NULL,   parName,   kind = "q",   owner = "KWB",   dbg = FALSE )

title: Get Metadata About Data Sources — hsDataSource
text: qua.level data quality level ("r" = raw, "v" = validated, "c" = calibrated) moniPoint name monitoring point, e.g. "STA", "TEG", "MUE" parName name parameter, e.g. "AFS", "CSB", "CSBf" kind kind data: "q" = water quality, "h" = hydraulic data, "r" = rain owner owner data, one "KWB", "SEN", "BWB" dbg whether show debug messages

title: Get Metadata About Data Sources — hsDataSource
text: Returns list following named elements: mdb: full path Access database, tbl: table name, tsField: name timestamp field, parField: name parameter field

title: Get Metadata About Data Sources — hsDataSource
code: # Get source information of validated data of parameter AFS from Stallstr.  si <- hsDataSource("v", "STA", "AFS") si  #> $mdb #> [1] "/miacso$/Daten/ACCESS/KwbMonitoring/2VAL/KWB_STA_VAL.mdb" #>  #> $tbl #> [1] "KWB_STA_ScanPar_AFS_VAL" #>  #> $tsField #> [1] "myDateTime" #>  #> $parField #> [1] "AFS_A" #>  # ouput: #  $db #  [1] "//moby/miacso$/Daten/ACCESS/KwbMonitoring/2VAL/KWB_STA_VAL.mdb" #  #  $tbl #  [1] "KWB_STA_ScanPar_AFS_VAL" #  #  $tsfield #  [1] "myDateTime" #  #  $parfield #  [1] "AFS_A"  # Access the pieces of information with the $ operator: si$mdb # [1] "//moby/miacso$/Daten/ACCESS/KwbMonitoring/2VAL/KWB_STA_VAL.mdb" #> [1] "/miacso$/Daten/ACCESS/KwbMonitoring/2VAL/KWB_STA_VAL.mdb" si$tbl # [1] "KWB_STA_ScanPar_AFS_VAL" #> [1] "KWB_STA_ScanPar_AFS_VAL"

title: Read Values and Fingerprints from Database — hsGetFpAndValRaw
text: Return query result new data.frame (special type   list) elements "dts" (date-times), "pars" (parameter values)   "fps" (fingerprints)

what: Provide Information on Data Availabilities — hsMiaCsoDataAvailability
title: Provide Information on Data Availabilities — hsMiaCsoDataAvailability
text: Data availability raw/validated/calibrated data parameter para, measured monitoring point moniPoint dateFirst dateLast.

title: Provide Information on Data Availabilities — hsMiaCsoDataAvailability
code: hsMiaCsoDataAvailability(   level,   moniPoint,   parName,   dateFirst = NULL,   dateLast = NULL,   tstep = NULL,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Provide Information on Data Availabilities — hsMiaCsoDataAvailability
text: level one "r" (= raw), "v" (= validated), "c" (= calibrated) moniPoint one "STA" (= Stallstr.), "TEG" (= Tegeler Weg), "MUE" (= Muehlendamm) parName e.g. "AFS", "CSB", "CSBf", ... dateFirst Date object representing first date considered dateLast Date object representing last date considered tstep expected time step time stamps seconds. Default: minimum time difference found consecutive timestamps given interval dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Provide Information on Data Availabilities — hsMiaCsoDataAvailability
code: if (FALSE) { # Get data availability of raw data of parameter "CSBf", measured at # monitoring point "TEG" (Tegeler Weg) between 2011-04-01 and 2011-10-01 da <- hsMiaCsoDataAvailability("r", "TEG", "CSBf", "2011-04-01", "2011-10-01") head(da) } # Output: #   myInterval myCount   myAvail # 1 2011-04-01    1440 100.00000 # 2 2011-04-02    1440 100.00000 # 3 2011-04-03    1440 100.00000 # 4 2011-04-04    1440 100.00000 # 5 2011-04-05    1440 100.00000 # 6 2011-04-06    1409  97.84722

title: Names of available parameters — hsPars
text: Names available parameters

title: Names of available parameters — hsPars
code: hsPars(   kind = NULL,   moniPoint = NULL,   qua.level = "c",   owner = "KWB",   dbg = TRUE )

title: Names of available parameters — hsPars
text: kind kind data: "q" = water quality, "h" = hydraulic data, "r" = rain moniPoint name monitoring point, e.g. "STA", "TEG", "MUE" qua.level data quality level ("r" = raw, "v" = validated, "c" = calibrated) owner owner data, one "KWB", "SEN", "BWB" dbg whether show debug messages

title: Names of available parameters — hsPars
text: Returns names available parameters

what: Plot all MIA CSO Data Availabilities — hsPlotAllDataAvailabilities
title: Plot all MIA CSO Data Availabilities — hsPlotAllDataAvailabilities
text: Plots availability raw validated data different monitoring points parameters. monitoring point pdf file "hsDataAvailability_<MP>" <MP> acronym monitoring point created directory \(strPdfDir\).

title: Plot all MIA CSO Data Availabilities — hsPlotAllDataAvailabilities
Plot all MIA CSO Data Availabilities — hsPlotAllDataAvailabilities
text: moniPoints vector containing names monitoring points, e.g. c("TEG", "MUE") parNames vector containing names parameters, e.g. c("AFS", "CSB", "CSBf") dates vector containing list Date objects pdfDir path output directory created pdf-files shall written.

title: Plot all MIA CSO Data Availabilities — hsPlotAllDataAvailabilities
text: 2012-04-17;HSB;example removed

title: Plot all MIA CSO Data Availabilities — hsPlotAllDataAvailabilities
code: if (FALSE) { # Generate pdf files containing data availability plots for parameters  # "AFS", "CSB", "CSBf", measured at monitoring points "MUE" (Muehlendamm), # "TEG" (Tegeler Weg), "STA" (Stallstr.) within two different # time intervals: 2010-01-01 to 2010-07-01 and  2011-01-01 to 2011-07-01. hsPlotAllDataAvailabilities(   c("MUE", "TEG", "STA"),    c("AFS", "CSB", "CSBf"),   as.Date(c("2010-01-01", "2010-07-01", "2011-01-01", "2011-07-01")),    tempdir() )  # Show data availability plots for Muehlendamm in pdf viewer pdfFile <- file.path(tempdir(), "hsDataAvailability_MUE.pdf") system(paste(options("pdfviewer"), pdfFile)) }

what: Plots availability of raw and validated data as bar plot into one plot — hsPlotMiaCsoAvailabilities
title: Plots availability of raw and validated data as bar plot into one plot — hsPlotMiaCsoAvailabilities
text: Plots availability raw validated data bar plot one plot

title: Plots availability of raw and validated data as bar plot into one plot — hsPlotMiaCsoAvailabilities
Plots availability of raw and validated data as bar plot into one plot — hsPlotMiaCsoAvailabilities
text: qTypes vector data quality type codes, e.g. c("r", "v", "c"): raw, validated calibrated data moniPoint name monitoring point, e.g. "TEG", "MUE", "STA" parName name parameter, e.g. "AFS", "CSB", "CSBf" dateFirst Date object representing first date considered dateLast Date object representing last date considered

title: Experimental! — miadir
text: function work! intension get full path MS Access database file filtering certain criteria (owner, kind data, quality level (raw, valid, calibrated) time resolution)...

title: Experimental! — miadir
code: miadir(   owner = NA,   kind = NA,   quaLevel = NA,   resol = NA,   DS = kwb.misc::hsDirStructure(dbg = dbg),   depth = 1,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Experimental! — miadir
text: owner data owner kind kind data (hydraulic, quality, rain) quaLevel quality level (raw, validated, calibrated) resol resolution DS directory structure depth depth dbg whether show debug messages
